Except from KLIA, local taxis operate from the main towns of the district. From KLIA, a coupon airport taxi system operates. See the "
" section of the KL article for details.

During race season, the simplest way is to catch the train from KL Sentral to KLIA and then transfer onto shuttle buses which will bring you to the circuit. The operator of KLA Ekspres and KLIA Transit has transport packages which cover the train ride and shuttle bus. See the KLIA Ekspres website

.

On non-race days, it may be difficult to get to the circuit by public transport. Your best bet is by taxi.
Public transport within Sepang is limited to the

, which connects KTM Komuter's Nilai station to the airport via the Sepang International Circuit race-track (RM 2, every 30 minutes).

Hotels and, when races are on, the F1 circuit run shuttle buses to ferry visitors to and from the airport.

value: . One of the newest Formula 1 racing tracks in the world and the home of the yearly Malaysian Grand Prix, as well as other racing events. Tickets are quite affordable (at least by F1 standards) and start from RM 100 for a one-day C3 hillstand ticket - and go up to RM 1,750 for a 3-day "Diamond" upper mall ticket.

, Sunday Services in English are from 10.30AM (local time) to about 12.00PM, 50 Jalan Airport City 2, Airport City Business Centre, Kota Warisan, 48900 Sepang. Walking distance from Salak Tinggi ERL station but you have to take the KLIA Transit Rail (not the Express one) to be able to exit at this station.

The best eating options are at the airport. Levels 2 and 4 (landside) offer food courts serving Malaysian fare at only slightly inflated prices.

value: ). The best intown Chinese/Muslim Seafood Cuisines offers a range of over 200 choices of eateries geared for locals and internationals at affordable prices which everyone can eat.

There are only a few places to stay in Sepang itself.  See
for hotels on airport grounds.  If you have a bit of time to spare, you may want to consider zipping to the city on the KLIA Ekspres (28 min) and staying at the hotels in
instead i.e Hilton and Le Meridien.

value: content=8 Jalan Airport City 2, Airport City Business Centre, Kota Warisan., very affordable, excellent for transfers as it is very near the airport, friendly environment, transport to and from KLIA/LCCT provided.

value: content=An uneasy cross between a resort and a boarding school, this three-star hotel is fine for a night's sleep but little more. Small pool and gym, free shuttle bus (5 min) to/from airport every 30 minutes and breakfast included. At RM150 and up, rooms are overpriced by Malaysian standards, but still just a third of what the Pan Pacific charges.888
content=Internet rates from RM260, including breakfast and hourly shuttle bus to airport (8 minutes).

There is wireless internet available for free.

value: - Malaysia's capital city, is just half an hour away.
- Malaysia's new capital-to-be, is 15 minutes away by train.
- a small town in Sepang district which offered some pleasant surprises. The dragon fruit farm and plenty of traditional Foochew delights make this place worth a visit.

- the beach here was first promoted as a tourism destination by the Selangor Government in the early 1990s. It had little more that its fine sand lined by tall pine trees extending a long way before reaching the sea waters, some ikan bakar spots and chalets to offer.
